publications.title: A Requirements Driven Digital Twin Framework: Specification and Opportunities
publications.authors: J. Moyne, Y. Qamsane, E. C. Balta, I. Kovalenko, J. Faris, K. Barton, and D. M. Tilbury
publications.abstract: A set of requirements for a Digital Twin (DT) framework has been derived from analysis of DT definitions, DTs in use today, expected DT applications in the near future, and longer-term DT trends and the DT vision in Smart Manufacturing. These requirements include elements of re-usability, interoperability, interchangeability, maintainability, extensibility, and autonomy across the entire DT lifecycle.

publications.title: A Methodology to Develop and Implement Digital Twin Solutions for Manufacturing Systems
publications.authors: Y. Qamsane, J. Moyne, M. Toothman, I. Kovalenko, E. C. Balta, J. Faris, D. M. Tilbury, and K. Barton
publications.abstract: This paper introduces a Digital Twin (DT) solution development methodology as a generic procedure for analyzing and developing DTs for manufacturing systems. A case study illustrates the advantages of the proposed methodology in supporting manufacturing DT solutions.

publications.title: An Adaptive, State-Based Framework for Fault Prediction in Rotating Equipment
publications.authors: M. Toothman, B. Braun, S. J. Bury, J. Moyne, D. M. Tilbury, K. Barton
publications.abstract: Advanced framework for predictive maintenance using adaptive state-based models for rotating manufacturing equipment.

publications.title: Digital-Twin based Cyber-Attack Detection Framework for Cyber-Physical Manufacturing Systems
publications.authors: E. C. Balta, M. Pease, J. Moyne, K. Barton, and D. M. Tilbury
publications.abstract: Novel cybersecurity framework leveraging digital twin technology for detecting and mitigating cyber attacks in manufacturing systems.

publications.title: Full Stack Virtual Commissioning: Requirements Framework to Bridge Gaps in Current Virtual Commissioning Process
publications.authors: J. B. Sim, K. N. Shah, M. Saez, J. Abell, Y. Zhou, J. Faris, D. M. Tilbury, and K. Barton
publications.abstract: Comprehensive approach to virtual commissioning using full-stack digital twin implementations for manufacturing systems.

publications.title: A Digital Twin Framework for Mechanical System Health State Estimation
publications.authors: M. Toothman, B. Braun, S. J. Bury, M. Dessauer, K. Henderson, S. Phillips, Y. Yixin, D. M. Tilbury, J. Moyne, K. Barton
publications.abstract: Digital twin framework for estimating mechanical system health states in manufacturing environments.

publications.title: An Integrated Framework for Dynamic Manufacturing Planning to Obtain New Line Configurations
publications.authors: L. Poudel, I. Kovalenko, R. Geng, M. Takaharu, Y. Nonaka, N. Takahiro, U. Shota, D. M. Tilbury, and K. Barton
publications.abstract: Integrated framework for dynamic manufacturing planning to achieve new production line configurations using digital twin technologies.

publications.title: A Digital Twin Framework for Performance Monitoring and Anomaly Detection in Fused Deposition Modeling
publications.authors: E. Balta, D. Tilbury, and K. Barton
publications.abstract: Digital twin framework for performance monitoring and anomaly detection in additive manufacturing processes, specifically fused deposition modeling.

publications.title: Real-time manufacturing machine and system performance monitoring using Internet of Things
publications.authors: Miguel Saez, Francisco Maturana, Kira Barton, and Dawn Tilbury
publications.abstract: Real-time performance monitoring system for manufacturing machines and systems using Internet of Things technologies and digital twin principles.

publications.title: Digital Twin Framework for Reconfiguration Management: Concept & Evaluation
publications.authors: B. Caesar, K. Barton, D. M. Tilbury, A. Fay
publications.abstract: Digital twin framework for managing reconfiguration in manufacturing systems, including concept development and evaluation methodologies.
